(Yes, I know the destruction of Krypton is a tragedy, but it is one far removed from Kal's lived experiences. He's aware of it, but Kal has more in common with foundlings like Gilgamesh & Beowulf than with heroes whose traumas define them.) https://t.co/XCtBhMhI9f

Superman protects life. He doesn't have a tragedy in his background, like Batman & others, to teach him the value of life. He knows it. It is something the Kents instilled in him. This is my fundamental issue w/Synder's read on the character. Synder assumes he's as flawed as us. https://t.co/2pAkqyOliJ

[2] Kal would never have said "Krypton had its chance!" He would never have destroyed those embryos. He would never have killed Zod. (For that matter, he would have moved that fight far away from Metropolis.) https://t.co/Pqbr0e4DrG
[1] Kal would never have let Jonathan Kent die, secret identity be damned. https://t.co/VqT1uUbQDo

Recently rewatched Man of Steel. I've decided that my intense early criticism, while warranted, speaks more to disappointment at key missteps than overall quality of film.
It's a good movie that gets Kal-El wrong in two key ways: 👇🏻 https://t.co/PxDlX8BpR2
